definition: to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: We will not be frightened by threats.
sentences.chinese: 威胁是不能把我们吓倒的。

sentences.english: Do not let the math jargon intimidate you.
sentences.chinese: 可别让这些数学术语把你吓倒。

sentences.english: Don't be overawed by authorities and big names.
sentences.chinese: 不要被权威名人所吓倒。

sentences.english: We'll never be intimidated by war threats, including nuclear war threats.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不会被战争威胁包括核战争威胁所吓倒。

sentences.english: He was too clever a man to be bluffed.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很灵的人，不会为虚张声势所吓倒。

sentences.english: They mistake their man if they think they can frighten him.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们认为可以把他吓倒，那是认错人了。

sentences.english: Danger did not daunt the hero.
sentences.chinese: 危险并没有吓倒这位英雄。

sentences.english: Danger did not daunt the hero.
Parker told VOA she would not be deterred by terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 帕克对美国之音说，她不会被恐怖主义所吓倒。

sentences.english: Wang Yung-ching is not intimidated by other people's cynicism.
sentences.chinese: 王永庆没有被别人的冷嘲热讽吓倒。

sentences.english: I'm not spooked for the threat.
Don't be scared of high- flown language ofeconomists and Cabinet Ministers.
sentences.chinese: 不要被经济学家和内阁大臣们的高谈阔论所吓倒。

sentences.english: But it's clear that Google investors aren't quaking in their boots.
sentences.chinese: 但很明显，谷歌的投资者并没有被吓倒。

sentences.english: Don't let that scare you, it's SO worth it!
sentences.chinese: 不要让它吓倒你，因为练习它是很值得的。

sentences.english: But nor can the West be cowed.
sentences.chinese: 但是西方也不能就此被吓倒。

definition: to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
to faint from fear/to be frightened into fits/shell-shocked
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to pay attention to/to care about/to attach importance to
